column4: Hmm... I don't have permission to visit my external hard drive sd1.
*sda1
Why can't I view my external hard drive? I don't have permission for some reason even though this is a clean install.
I am obviously the owner as I'm the only user on the entire system.
Root seems to be the owner.
do you know what root is?
on linux just because you are the only user does not mean you own everything
I doubt it.. how are you attempting to mount it?
how are you mounting the ones that work fine?
can you tell me what is in /etc/fstab for the external drive?
what do you do to access the drive?
click on something?
aha... can you paste /etc/fstab to #flood?
listen to bob2 ... he is more on the case :)
can you use the command line?
I assure you it can be done in ubuntu :)
sda1 is the one you are trying to mount?
it is easier for me :)
I am leaving you in the trusty hands of bob2 :)
it should be mount ro of course
add noauto,ro,users
instead of defaults
er... how?
ask bob2  :) bye
